content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES

###Iron Plate Production Line (Position x=0.0 to x=2.0, y=0.0)
Consists of two stone furnaces working in parallel:
- Stone furnace 1 at (0,0) processing iron ore into plates
- Stone furnace 2 at (2,0) processing iron ore into plates
Both furnaces are operational with coal fuel and iron ore input

###Copper Plate Production (Position x=4.0, y=4.0)
Single stone furnace processing copper ore into copper plates
- Operational with coal fuel and copper ore input

###Electronic Circuit Assembly Line (Position x=6.5 to x=12.5, y=11.5)
Automated assembly line consisting of:
- Input wooden chest at (6.5, 11.5) containing iron plates and copper cables
- Burner inserter at (7.5, 11.5) moving materials from input chest to assembler
- Assembling machine at (9.5, 11.5) crafting electronic circuits
- Burner inserter at (11.5, 11.5) moving finished circuits to output chest
- Output wooden chest at (12.5, 11.5) storing completed electronic circuits

###Power Generation System (Position x=-9.5 to x=-2.5, y=22.5 to y=26.5)
Complete power generation setup:
- Offshore pump at (-9.5, 24.5) extracting water
- Pipe network connecting pump to boiler (water system)
- Boiler at (-7.0, 24.5) converting water to steam
- Steam pipe network connecting boiler to engine
- Steam engine at (-2.5, 24.5) generating electricity
- Small electric poles distributing power

###Research Facility (Position x=0.5, y=28.5 to y=31.5)
Science pack handling system:
- Lab at (0.5, 28.5)
- Burner inserter at (0.5, 30.5) feeding science packs
- Storage chest at (0.5, 31.5) containing automation and logistic science packs

ERROR TIPS

### Assembler Resource Shortage Errors
- Ensure consistent supply of both iron plates and copper cables to the electronic circuit assembler
- Monitor input chest contents to maintain required ingredients

### Steam Engine Operation
- Maintain proper coal levels in boiler to ensure consistent steam production
- Monitor steam temperature and pressure for optimal power generation

### Inserter Operation
- Keep burner inserters fueled with coal to prevent interruptions in material movement
- Ensure proper alignment between inserters and target containers/machines
